type.description: Type of assertion. Assertion types can evolve to span Datasets, Flows (Pipelines), Models, Features etc.

datasetAssertion.description: A Dataset Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is DATASET.

freshnessAssertion.description: An Freshness Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is FRESHNESS.

volumeAssertion.description: An Volume Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is VOLUME.

sqlAssertion.description: A SQL Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is SQL.

fieldAssertion.description: A Field Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is FIELD.

schemaAssertion.description: An schema Assertion definition. This field is populated when the type is DATA_SCHEMA

customAssertion.description: A Custom Assertion definition. This field is populated when type is CUSTOM.

source.description:
The source or origin of the Assertion definition.

If the source type of the Assertion is EXTERNAL, it is expected to have a corresponding dataPlatformInstance aspect detailing
the platform where it was ingested from.

lastUpdated.description:
The time at which the assertion was last updated and the actor who updated it.
This field is only present for Native assertions updated after this field was introduced.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the assertion

DatasetAssertionInfo.description: Attributes that are applicable to single-Dataset Assertions

dataset.description: The dataset targeted by this assertion.

scope.description: Scope of the Assertion. What part of the dataset does this assertion apply to?

fields.description:
One or more dataset schema fields that are targeted by this assertion.

This field is expected to be provided if the assertion scope is DATASET_COLUMN.

aggregation.description:
Standardized assertion operator
This field is left blank if there is no selected aggregation or metric for a particular column.

parameters.description: Standard parameters required for the assertion. e.g. min_value, max_value, value, columns

nativeParameters.description: Native parameters required for the assertion.

AssertionStdAggregation.description: The function that is applied to the aggregation input (schema, rows, column values) before evaluating an operator.

AssertionStdOperator.description: A boolean operator that is applied on the input to an assertion, after an aggregation function has been applied.

value.description: The value parameter of an assertion

maxValue.description: The maxValue parameter of an assertion

minValue.description: The minValue parameter of an assertion

type.description: The type of the freshness assertion being monitored.

entity.description: The entity targeted by this Freshness check.

schedule.description: Produce FAILURE Assertion Result if the asset is not updated on the cadence and within the time range described by the schedule.

filter.description:
A definition of the specific filters that should be applied, when performing monitoring.
If not provided, there is no filter, and the full table is under consideration.

FreshnessAssertionSchedule.description: Attributes defining a single Freshness schedule.

type.description:
The type of a Freshness Assertion Schedule.

Once we support data-time-relative schedules (e.g. schedules relative to time partitions),
we will add those schedule types here.

cron.description: A cron schedule. This field is required when type is CRON.

fixedInterval.description: A fixed interval schedule. This field is required when type is FIXED_INTERVAL.

FreshnessCronSchedule.description: Attributes defining a CRON-formatted schedule used for defining a freshness assertion.

cron.description: A cron-formatted execution interval, as a cron string, e.g. 1 * * * *

timezone.description: Timezone in which the cron interval applies, e.g. America/Los Angeles

windowStartOffsetMs.description:
An optional offset in milliseconds to SUBTRACT from the timestamp generated by the cron schedule
to generate the lower bounds of the "freshness window", or the window of time in which an event must have occurred in order for the Freshness check
to be considering passing.

If left empty, the start of the SLA window will be the _end_ of the previously evaluated Freshness window.

FixedIntervalSchedule.description: Attributes defining a relative fixed interval SLA schedule.

unit.description: Interval unit such as minute/hour/day etc.

DatasetFilter.description:
A definition of filters that should be used when
querying an external Dataset or Table.

Note that this models should NOT be used for working with
search / filter on DataHub Platform itself.

type.description:
How the partition will be represented in this model.

In the future, we'll likely add support for more structured
predicates.

sql.description:
The raw where clause string which will be used for monitoring.
Required if the type is SQL.

VolumeAssertionInfo.description: Attributes defining a dataset Volume Assertion

type.description: The type of the volume assertion being monitored.

entity.description: The entity targeted by this Volume check.

rowCountTotal.description:
Produce FAILURE Assertion Result if the row count of the asset does not meet specific requirements.
Required if type is 'ROW_COUNT_TOTAL'

rowCountChange.description:
Produce FAILURE Assertion Result if the delta row count of the asset does not meet specific requirements
within a given period of time.
Required if type is 'ROW_COUNT_CHANGE'

incrementingSegmentRowCountTotal.description:
Produce FAILURE Assertion Result if the asset's latest incrementing segment row count total
does not meet specific requirements. Required if type is 'INCREMENTING_SEGMENT_ROW_COUNT_TOTAL'

incrementingSegmentRowCountChange.description:
Produce FAILURE Assertion Result if the asset's incrementing segment row count delta
does not meet specific requirements. Required if type is 'INCREMENTING_SEGMENT_ROW_COUNT_CHANGE'

filter.description:
A definition of the specific filters that should be applied, when performing monitoring.
If not provided, there is no filter, and the full table is under consideration.

RowCountTotal.description: Attributes defining a ROW_COUNT_TOTAL volume assertion.

operator.description:
The operator you'd like to apply.

Note that only numeric operators are valid inputs:
GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
BETWEEN.

parameters.description:
The parameters you'd like to provide as input to the operator.

Note that only numeric parameter types are valid inputs: NUMBER.

RowCountChange.description: Attributes defining a ROW_COUNT_CHANGE volume assertion.

type.description: The type of the value used to evaluate the assertion: a fixed absolute value or a relative percentage.

operator.description:
The operator you'd like to apply.

Note that only numeric operators are valid inputs:
GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
BETWEEN.

parameters.description:
The parameters you'd like to provide as input to the operator.

Note that only numeric parameter types are valid inputs: NUMBER.

AssertionValueChangeType.description: An enum to represent a type of change in an assertion value, metric, or measurement.

IncrementingSegmentRowCountTotal.description: Attributes defining an INCREMENTING_SEGMENT_ROW_COUNT_TOTAL volume assertion.

segment.description: A specification of how the 'segment' can be derived using a column and an optional transformer function.

operator.description:
The operator you'd like to apply.

Note that only numeric operators are valid inputs:
GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
BETWEEN.

parameters.description:
The parameters you'd like to provide as input to the operator.

Note that only numeric parameter types are valid inputs: NUMBER.

IncrementingSegmentSpec.description:
Core attributes required to identify an incrementing segment in a table. This type is mainly useful
for tables that constantly increase with new rows being added on a particular cadence (e.g. fact or event tables)

An incrementing segment represents a logical chunk of data which is INSERTED
into a dataset on a regular interval, along with the presence of a constantly-incrementing column
value such as an event time, date partition, or last modified column.

An incrementing segment is principally identified by 2 key attributes combined:

 1. A field or column that represents the incrementing value. New rows that are inserted will be identified using this column.
    Note that the value of this column may not by itself represent the "bucket" or the "segment" in which the row falls.

 2. [Optional] An transformer function that may be applied to the selected column value in order
    to obtain the final "segment identifier" or "bucket identifier". Rows that have the same value after applying the transformation
    will be grouped into the same segment, using which the final value (e.g. row count) will be determined.

field.description: The field to use to generate segments. It must be constantly incrementing as new rows are inserted.

transformer.description:
Optional transformer function to apply to the field in order to obtain the final segment or bucket identifier.
If not provided, then no operator will be applied to the field. (identity function)

SchemaFieldSpec.description: Lightweight spec used for referencing a particular schema field.

type.description: The DataHub standard schema field type.

IncrementingSegmentFieldTransformer.description:
The definition of the transformer function  that should be applied to a given field / column value in a dataset
in order to determine the segment or bucket that it belongs to, which in turn is used to evaluate
volume assertions.

type.description: A 'standard' transformer type. Note that not all source systems will support all operators.

nativeType.description:
The 'native' transformer type, useful as a back door if a custom operator is required.
This field is required if the type is NATIVE.

IncrementingSegmentRowCountChange.description: Attributes defining an INCREMENTING_SEGMENT_ROW_COUNT_CHANGE volume assertion.

segment.description: A specification of how the 'segment' can be derived using a column and an optional transformer function.

type.description: The type of the value used to evaluate the assertion: a fixed absolute value or a relative percentage.

operator.description:
The operator you'd like to apply to the row count value

Note that only numeric operators are valid inputs:
GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
BETWEEN.

parameters.description:
The parameters you'd like to provide as input to the operator.

Note that only numeric parameter types are valid inputs: NUMBER.

type.description: The type of the SQL assertion being monitored.

entity.description: The entity targeted by this SQL check.

statement.description:
The SQL statement to be executed when evaluating the assertion (or computing the metric).
This should be a valid and complete statement, executable by itself.

Usually this should be a SELECT query statement.

changeType.description:
The type of the value used to evaluate the assertion: a fixed absolute value or a relative percentage.
This value is required if the type is METRIC_CHANGE.

operator.description:
The operator you'd like to apply to the result of the SQL query.

Note that at this time, only numeric operators are valid inputs:
GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO,
BETWEEN.

parameters.description:
The parameters you'd like to provide as input to the operator.

Note that only numeric parameter types are valid inputs: NUMBER.

type.description: The type of the field assertion being monitored.

entity.description: The entity targeted by this Field check.

fieldValuesAssertion.description:
The definition of an assertion that validates individual values of a field / column for a set of rows.
This type of assertion verifies that each column value meets a particular requirement.

fieldMetricAssertion.description:
The definition of an assertion that validates a common metric obtained about a field / column for a set of rows.
This type of assertion verifies that the value of a high-level metric obtained by aggregating over a column meets
expectations

filter.description:
A definition of the specific filters that should be applied, when performing monitoring.
If not provided, there is no filter, and the full table is under consideration.
If using DataHub Dataset Profiles as the assertion source type, the value of this field will be ignored.

FieldValuesAssertion.description:
Attributes defining a field values assertion, which asserts that the values for a field / column
of a dataset / table matches a set of expectations.

In other words, this type of assertion acts as a semantic constraint applied to fields for a specific column.

TODO: We should display the "failed row count" to the user if the column fails the verification rules.
TODO: Determine whether we need an "operator" that can be applied to the field.

transform.description:
An optional transform to apply to field values
before evaluating the operator.

If none is applied, the field value will be compared as is.

operator.description:
The predicate to evaluate against a single value of the field.
Depending on the operator, parameters may be required in order to successfully
evaluate the assertion against the field value.

parameters.description: Standard parameters required for the assertion. e.g. min_value, max_value, value, columns

failThreshold.description:
Additional customization about when the assertion
should be officially considered failing.

excludeNulls.description:
Whether to ignore or allow nulls when running the values assertion. (i.e.
consider only non-null values) using operators OTHER than the IS_NULL operator.

Defaults to true, allowing null values.

FieldTransform.description:
Definition of a transform applied to the values of a column / field.
Note that the applicability of a field transform ultimately depends on the native type
of the field / column.

Model has single field to permit extension.

type.description:
The type of the field transform, e.g. the transformation
function / operator to apply.

The type of failure threshold. Either based on the number
of column values (rows) that fail the expectations, or the percentage
of the total rows under consideration.

value.description:
By default this is 0, meaning that ALL column values (i.e. rows) must
meet the defined expectations.

FieldMetricAssertion.description:
Attributes defining a field metric assertion, which asserts an expectation against
a common metric derived from the set of field / column values, for example:
max, min, median, null count, null percentage, unique count, unique percentage, and more.

metric.description:
The specific metric to assert against. This is the value that
will be obtained by applying a standard operation, such as an aggregation,
to the selected field.

operator.description:
The predicate to evaluate against the metric for the field / column.
Depending on the operator, parameters may be required in order to successfully
evaluate the assertion against the metric value.

parameters.description: Standard parameters required for the assertion. e.g. min_value, max_value, value, columns

FieldMetricType.description:
A standard metric that can be derived from the set of values
for a specific field / column of a dataset / table.

SchemaAssertionInfo.description: Attributes that are applicable to schema assertions

entity.description: The entity targeted by the assertion

schema.description:
A definition of the expected structure for the asset

Note that many of the fields of this model, especially those related to metadata (tags, terms)
will go unused in this context.

compatibility.description: The required compatibility level for the schema assertion to pass.

SchemaMetadata.description: SchemaMetadata to describe metadata related to store schema

schemaName.description: Schema name e.g. PageViewEvent, identity.Profile, ams.account_management_tracking

platform.description: Standardized platform urn where schema is defined. The data platform Urn (urn:li:platform:{platform_name})

version.description: Every change to SchemaMetadata in the resource results in a new version. Version is server assigned. This version is differ from platform native schema version.

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this resource/association/sub-resource. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this resource/association/sub-resource. If no modification has happened since creation, lastModified should be the same as created. A value of 0 for time indicates missing data.

deleted.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the deletion of this resource/association/sub-resource. Logically, deleted MUST have a later timestamp than creation. It may or may not have the same time as lastModified depending upon the resource/association/sub-resource semantics.

dataset.description: Dataset this schema metadata is associated with.

cluster.description: The cluster this schema metadata resides from

hash.description: the SHA1 hash of the schema content

platformSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform.

fields.description: Client provided a list of fields from document schema.

primaryKeys.description: Client provided list of fields that define primary keys to access record. Field order defines hierarchical espresso keys. Empty lists indicates absence of primary key access patter. Value is a SchemaField@fieldPath.

foreignKeysSpecs.description: Map captures all the references schema makes to external datasets. Map key is ForeignKeySpecName typeref.

foreignKeys.description: List of foreign key constraints for the schema

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.

EspressoSchema.description: Schema text of an espresso table schema.

OracleDDL.description: Schema holder for oracle data definition language that describes an oracle table.

tableSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

MySqlDDL.description: Schema holder for MySql data definition language that describes an MySql table.

tableSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

PrestoDDL.description: Schema holder for presto data definition language that describes a presto view.

rawSchema.description: The raw schema in the dataset's platform. This includes the DDL and the columns extracted from DDL.

documentSchema.description: The native kafka document schema. This is a human readable avro document schema.

documentSchemaType.description: The native kafka document schema type. This can be AVRO/PROTOBUF/JSON.

keySchema.description: The native kafka key schema as retrieved from Schema Registry

keySchemaType.description: The native kafka key schema type. This can be AVRO/PROTOBUF/JSON.

BinaryJsonSchema.description: Schema text of binary JSON schema.

schema.description: The native schema text for binary JSON file format.

OrcSchema.description: Schema text of an ORC schema.

schema.description: The native schema for ORC file format.

KeyValueSchema.description: Schema text of a key-value store schema.

keySchema.description: The raw schema for the key in the key-value store.

valueSchema.description: The raw schema for the value in the key-value store.

OtherSchema.description: Schema holder for undefined schema types.

rawSchema.description: The native schema in the dataset's platform.

SchemaField.description: SchemaField to describe metadata related to dataset schema.

fieldPath.description: Flattened name of the field. Field is computed from jsonPath field.

jsonPath.description: Flattened name of a field in JSON Path notation.

nullable.description: Indicates if this field is optional or nullable

label.description:
Label of the field. Provides a more human-readable name for the field than field path. Some sources will
provide this metadata but not all sources have the concept of a label. If just one string is associated with
a field in a source, that is most likely a description.

Note that this field is deprecated and is not surfaced in the UI.

created.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this schema field.

lastModified.description: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this schema field.

type.description: Platform independent field type of the field.

nativeDataType.description: The native type of the field in the dataset's platform as declared by platform schema.

recursive.description: There are use cases when a field in type B references type A. A field in A references field of type B. In such cases, we will mark the first field as recursive.

glossaryTerms.description: Glossary terms associated with the field

isPartOfKey.description:
For schema fields that are part of complex keys, set this field to true
We do this to easily distinguish between value and key fields

isPartitioningKey.description:
For Datasets which are partitioned, this determines the partitioning key.
Note that multiple columns can be part of a partitioning key, but currently we do not support
rendering the ordered partitioning key.

jsonProps.description:
For schema fields that have other properties that are not modeled explicitly,
use this field to serialize those properties into a JSON string

valueType.description: Type of the value in a map

nestedType.description: List of types this array holds.

nestedTypes.description: List of types in union type.

GlobalTags.description: Tag aspect used for applying tags to an entity

tags.description: Tags associated with a given entity

TagAssociation.description:
Properties of an applied tag. For now, just an Urn. In the future we can extend this with other properties, e.g.
propagation parameters.

attribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

MetadataAttribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

actor.description:
The entity (e.g. a member URN) responsible for applying the assocated metadata. This can
either be a user (in case of UI edits) or the datahub system for automation.

source.description:
The DataHub source responsible for applying the associated metadata. This will only be filled out
when a DataHub source is responsible. This includes the specific metadata test urn, the automation urn.

sourceDetail.description:
The details associated with why this metadata was applied. For example, this could include
the actual regex rule, sql statement, ingestion pipeline ID, etc.

auditStamp.description: Audit stamp containing who reported the related business term

GlossaryTermAssociation.description: Properties of an applied glossary term.

urn.description: Urn of the applied glossary term

actor.description: The user URN which will be credited for adding associating this term to the entity

attribution.description: Information about who, why, and how this metadata was applied

ForeignKeySpec.description: Description of a foreign key in a schema.

foreignKey.description: Foreign key definition in metadata schema.

currentFieldPaths.description: List of fields in hosting(current) SchemaMetadata that conform a foreign key. List can contain a single entry or multiple entries if several entries in hosting schema conform a foreign key in a single parent dataset.

parentField.description: SchemaField@fieldPath that uniquely identify field in parent dataset that this field references.

UrnForeignKey.description: If SchemaMetadata fields make any external references and references are of type com.linkedin.common.Urn or any children, this models can be used to mark it.

ForeignKeyConstraint.description: Description of a foreign key constraint in a schema.

name.description: Name of the constraint, likely provided from the source

foreignFields.description: Fields the constraint maps to on the foreign dataset

sourceFields.description: Fields the constraint maps to on the source dataset

foreignDataset.description: Reference to the foreign dataset for ease of lookup

CustomAssertionInfo.description: Attributes that are applicable to Custom Assertions

type.description:
The type of custom assertion.
This is how your assertion will appear categorized in DataHub UI.

entity.description:
The entity targeted by this assertion.
This can have support more entityTypes (e.g. dataJob) in future

field.description:
dataset schema field targeted by this assertion.

This field is expected to be provided if the assertion is on dataset field

type.description: The type of the Assertion Source

created.description:
The time at which the assertion was initially created and the author who created it.
This field is only present for Native assertions created after this field was introduced.
